sentences.english: They had been working the stream for 10 days, but it hadn't panned out.
sentences.chinese: 他們連續10天在這條小溪裏淘金，但還沒淘出金子。

sentences.english: Foot of the mountain there is a clear bottoming out of the creek, streams next to the terraces.
sentences.chinese: 山腳下有一條清澈見底的小溪，小溪旁邊是梯田。

sentences.english: Foot of the mountain there is a clear bottoming out of the creek, streams next to the terraces.
sentences.chinese: 山腳下有一條清澈見底的小溪，小溪旁邊是梯田。

sentences.english: But the hot days of summer had dried up all the mountain brooks.
sentences.chinese: 可是夏季的炎熱天氣已經把所有的山澗小溪都曬乾了。

sentences.english: They both come complete with a matching streamlet , a pump , and fountain heads .
sentences.chinese: 他們都來完成同等額小溪，一個水泵，噴泉頭。

sentences.english: Every streams around the village of Shanghailuo flow into the mighty Changjiang here.
sentences.chinese: 上海螺村周圍的每一條小溪都在這裏流入長江。

sentences.english: Row row row your boat, gently down the stream.
sentences.chinese: 劃劃劃你的船，緩緩地流向小溪。

sentences.english: A slow flow makes flowers grow.
sentences.chinese: 一條緩緩的小溪讓花生長。

sentences.english: The stream winds through the valley.
I wade down a shallow pebbly stream daily.
sentences.chinese: 我每天沿着一條淺的有卵石的小溪跋涉。

sentences.english: Emotional and transparent image of mountain streams uncontaminated streams, lively and smooth.
sentences.chinese: 情緒透明的的像山澗中未經污染的小溪，歡快而流暢。

sentences.english: And there were gardens bright with sinuous rills.
sentences.chinese: 明媚的花園，曲折的小溪。

sentences.english: A stream meandered towards the sea.
sentences.chinese: 一條小溪蜿蜒流向大海。

sentences.english: The angler her line into the stream.
sentences.chinese: 那個垂釣者把魚線擲進了小溪裏。

sentences.english: Watching a waterfall is a bit different to watching a slow moving stream but each beautiful in its own right.
sentences.chinese: 瀑布和潺潺細流的小溪有些不同，但是都各有各的美。

sentences.english: A stream of clear brook opened another realm.
sentences.chinese: 一澗清澈的小溪開闢的另一番境界裏。

definition: water so clear you can see the bottom
Xiao Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
